chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:06 PM Defendant Sierra R Karklus in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Sierra R Karklus.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties agree on the issue of the bifurcated sentence.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

5/9/22: Court removes the condition about entering any premises that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, unless they initiate the contact or it is an emergency.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to contact the Clerk's office by 1/28/2022 for the signing of the signature bond, if not done by 1/28/2022 a warrant will be issued.

01:52 PM Defendant Sierra R Karklus in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case addresses motion for modification of bond.
Arguments by the Defense.  
State takes no position on the request.
Court grants motion and orders conditions of bond modified to eliminate "Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store, starting January 22, 2022."
Defendant updates address.
Hearing set for 5/27/22 to remain on the Court's calendar as previously scheduled.

10:18 AM Defendant Sierra R Karklus in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Griffis does not have an objection.  The Court will adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Time limits were previously waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:15 am.
